data.title: Nice place
data.text: We wàs up all day travelling from Washington State to back home in Ohio and needed  a place to crash,we stopped in Waterloo on a whim and it was a awesome experience,I highly recommend it ,courteous staff,nice room layout,too notch breakfast

data.title: Scraping the bottom of the barrel
data.text: I Waterloo over the weekend on business. There was a tournament in town so this was all there was. I can see why. Lobby is dingy, room smells even though there's fresh paint (obvious from the drops everywhere). Had to go to the front desk for towels. Awful insulation means that it's road noise (and train noise). All night long.

data.title: Sketchy!!
data.text: We are a basketball team who was passing through. We stepped off of the bus late at night and found a heroin needle laying on the ground! When we checked in they told us that the hotel was under renovation - there was carpet rolled up in the hallways. One of our player rooms found a bottle of assorted pills under their bed. One of the beds was not even in a frame, it was just a box spring and a mattress on the ground! The pillows were tiny - throw pillow size. The bathrooms were hardly clean with blue gunk coming off of the toilet and pee on the toilet rim. There was a bar across the street where there were fights breaking out around 2 in the morning. Was gross, not safe feeling, and we would NOT stay here or recommend this place. Breakfast was the only nice piece to this.

data.title: A decent place to lay your head
data.text: I stayed at the Waterloo Quality in for about 2 weeks almost waiting for approval on an apartment just across the street from the hotel.  The room was clean which is most important to me.  Unfortunately the phone in room 226 was unable to dial outside.  No worries though.  The staff was friendly and very helpful.  For instance when I checked out I forgot my laptop charger in the room.  The next day, one of the housekeeping staff returned it to me.  I was so grateful it wasn't thrown away.  I wish I could remember the name of the lady at the front desk.  She wears glasses and I think her hair is black with streaks of silver pulled back in either a pony tail or bun.  Anyway, she is amazing.  She's the person you want greeting you when you stay at a hotel.  Thanks so much for your hospitality.

data.title: Just like the name says----Quality.
data.text: We stayed on a Saturday night last minute. Checked in at about 10pm Front desk team was fine. Room had been freshly painted in the last month or so it appeared. The room was hot since the air conditioner was not left on. However, it did work QUITE well as we ended up chilly that night. Room was just fine----it was "quality" not Fabulous. We were fine with the rate and the services we received.

data.title: Clean, Quiet, and not too pricey.
data.text: In one of my stops in Iowa working on the pipeline I Came Upon This little town Waterloo Iowa I was tired and needed a place to rest that was affordable that would stay within my budget and the Quality Inn in Waterloo Iowa met my needs. There happened to be a an event on the streets this weekend and you could hardly hear it from the room. The rooms were clean spacious, and well-kept. This property is dated make no mistake about it but it is kept well and you cannot go wrong staying at this property don't always believe what you read in the other reviews that are out there on TripAdvisor I usually put those out there on TripAdvisor that I feel that need to be posted and this is my review thank you quality Inn and staff I enjoyed my two days at your property and if I'm ever in Waterloo Iowa then I'll stop by definitely, again.

data.title: Avoid this if you can!
data.text: Rooms out dated. We had a suite. The couch had broken legs, The phone did not work, there were no screens on windows. When we woke up the next day our dogs food was covered in ants. When we got off the elevator on 5th floor the smell was so bad I wanted to vomit. We tried to get another room in area but due to events they were all sold out. I kept all of my stuff on counters because I was afraid to sit it down. No other suites available so they discounted our room. The $89 rate was still to much. The parking lot was scary. The overhang on the hotel had been hit by a truck and never repaired. This is not the quality you would expect from a Quality Inn. Positive note- Michelle at desk did everything in her ability to resolve issue.

data.title: Stay anywhere else
data.text: Avoid this hotel. We reserved a 2 night stay months in advance for Waterloo Irish Festl. We did not receive the type of room we reserved although we showed up exactly at check in time (they said this was Expedia's fault although I had the confirmation showing the room type we reserved in-hand.). Staff told us, oh so sorry nothing we can do. We will give you a discount at check out. Check out staff says no, no we won't. The room was not terribly clean either and the staff at the check out desk called me a liar when I mentioned the problems we noted (dirty, rusty bathroom sink, urine on the toilet rim, broken shower handle). When we asked for the manager's name when we checked out the staff at the desk refused to give it to us. We will be calling the Waterloo Ramada Inn much, much earlier for 2017.

data.title: This Is The Best!...
data.text: We couldn't believe the spaciousness of the suite we got for a very low price. This was without a doubt our favorite hotel for our five-week trip. (We considering sub-letting the second room <grin>)...

data.title: Needs alot
data.text: The carpets are dirty. The windows need to be replaced! Actually I think they should tear down the hotel and replace it. The hotel is located  in a run down part of the waterfront , MA NY vacant buildings.  Not many choices for restaurants.  Waterloo should do more for this area.

data.title: Not a quality Quality Inn
data.text: We stayed for only one night. It was one of the worst experiences we have ever had in a hotel of  Choice Hotels family. It took over 30 minutes to check into the hotel due to only one person working the desk. We were given key cards to our first room(on the second floor), and the keys would not open the door. The person working the desk had to come up to the second floor and attempt to open the door with a master key card. The master key card would not open the door, so we were assigned a different room, on the fifth floor. The key cards would not open this door either. The person working the desk had to come up to the fifth floor to open the door with the master key card. After three attempts with the master key card, the door was opened. We finally get into a room. The room is warm on a hot day. The AC unit in the front room is unplugged with burn marks on the plug and the outlet. I plugged the unit into the outlet and it worked, but after 15-20 minutes it smelled hot and did not put out any cold air. I  unplugged the unit. The bedroom AC unit worked perfectly.  There were no other available rooms for us to move into, so we stayed in this room. We tested the keys before leaving to go out to eat dinner, and they did not work. So when we returned from dinner we had to have the desk person go up to the fifth floor and let us into our room...again. The faucet in the bathroom had a blocked aerator, so I fixed that issue myself. The room has a large whirlpool tub in the middle of the front room, which is great for a honeymooning couple, but not for two parents and their sons. Gladly there was a small, and I mean tiny small, shower in the bathroom.  The area around the whirlpool tub has metal transition strip to separate the tile floor from the carpet floor. The screws holding down the transition strip have heads raised too high and one of my sons caught his foot on it. The hallway of our floor was hot and muggy. The desk person was always helpful and never complained to us about the conditions of this hotel, but he had to help two other customers get into their rooms as well as reassigning them rooms because their key cards would not work either. The continental breakfast was modest in food selection, but tasted good. The clincher to our whole experience was not just inability to get into our room, but the city was having a parade at the time this whole check-in and room swapping fiasco was transpiring. No signage anywhere about a parade, let alone about our hotel being on the parade route. So, once we were into our room, we could not leave to go meet friends for dinner. We were trapped in because all of the entrances/exits to the parking lot were barricaded by either people lining the streets or police barricades. Additionally, the hotel has two elevators, only one worked but sounded as it were on its last leg. The building appears nice from the exterior, but inside is evidence of lack of maintenance. We stay in hotels of the Choice Hotel family because of great past experiences and a family member who works for Choice Hotels, so we receive discounts on rooms. We do not recommend this hotel, unless some serious repairs are made.

data.title: Not bad
data.text: Rooms were a bit out dated but they were very spacious, and most of all clean.  The desk clerks were alittle unprofessional, but very kind. The parking lot seemed a bit sketchy although we had no problems at all.

data.title: Wedding
data.text: I will never stay there again. Very poor quality, water only trickled out of bathroom sink, needs updated and thoroughly cleaned! Only one elevator worked and it was kind of scary sounding. Hallways smelled like stale smoke.

data.title: For one night it'll do.
data.text:
I was in town for my daughters graduation, and wanted to stay "cheap".  My company uses Corporate Lodging so I had them book me a room. Upon check in I was informed the room was actually booked for the previous night, but that they would honor the rate and give me a room ($60+ tax and stuff).
The room was just ok, flat screen in a cabinet that wouldn't stay open (has to block a door with a floor lamp), tub faucet that ALWAYS ran, and a slight smell of old stale cigarette smoke (most of these old places have that smell). 
There is a micro fridge and microwave. Breakfast was your typical cheap stuff (biscuit and gravy, toast, etc). 
I received notice on my credit card being charged for $83, more then I was told it would be so upon check out I'll get that right.

data.title: Excellent service!
data.text: The wonderful staff more than makes up for this less than 5 star hotel.  I stay here every year on business and the staff not only remembers me by name, they also remember my preferences and do their very best to make me feel cared for and at home,  There are other hotels nearby that are more up to date, but I'll always stay here.  (They had a few nicely upgraded  rooms to offer this year  so I assume more improvements are on the way).

data.title: Surprisingly nice!
data.text: I stayed here for 3 nights this past weekend and was very surprised at how nice it was.  I was very skeptical about staying after reading reviews on this site and others but gave it a go anyway.  I was pleasantly surprised.  We had one of the suites on the top floor and was very happy with it.  The place does need some minor repairs and some updating for sure but it was well worth the money. Our room was huge!  Had a living area with refrigerator and microwave and extra sink and counter. Then a bedroom with a Jacuzzi tub.  The front desk people were friendly and helpful. It was a sell out at the hotel with our state dart tournament in town and they kept up and did a great job. The breakfast in the morning was good also.  Was surprised to see hot foods offered as well as the cereal and yogurt. Overall the place was nothing like the reviews I have read.  My only suggestion would be to maybe do a little updating and this would make it even a better place to stay.  I notice people leave reviews more often when something is bad but not as often on some place that is just fine so I wanted to leave a good review letting people know that we had a great stay and had no major problems.

data.title: personal stay
data.text: The staff was very accommodative & responded quickly to any requests. Made arrangements for separate reservations so we did not have to move rooms in between nites. The rooms were very nice and clean. Very good value. Negatives- no ice machines, elevators very old & one not working. Positive-breakfast was very goo.  I only expected continental but they had hot food-waffles-biscuits&gravy-boiled eggs.  Overall a very good experience

data.title: Not the place to go to it was not good at all
data.text:
The sink was all plug up the shower was broken to I left after 2hr ..got some of my money which I was mad never again....
will I go back there .....There was hair on the bed to. It small like smoke .....all over .....Pay a little more and be happy

data.title: Avoid if you like smoke free
data.text: First of all we did not feel safe when we drove up due to some of the people around the lobby area. Our group stayed on two different floors and as soon as we got off the elevator on both levels the place reeked of strong cigarette smoke and the room were just as bad. Even though the doors said smoke free my bed spread had cigarette burns on it and the other room had rather big spots of discoloration on them. The flip door latch was broke on one room door and the bathroom in that room looked like someone forgot to come back and finish remodeling it.

data.title: No even good
data.text: This place is sketchy, old outdated and in a strange area. Our safe door latch was broken, there was a hole in the suite door, only one towel in a jacuzzi suite, the blow dryer was missing, the toilet didn't flush, popcorn under the pullout bed, had a faint smoke smell everywhere, water dripping in buckets in the lobby, the elevator is extremely loud. We had all these issues are were nit offered a refund at all. The price is was quoted upon making reservations was not the price upon check in. It was 11.00 more. This place is very dingy and old!
